date.headline: Before WWII
date.text: The area now occupied by the Paducah Site was used for agricultural purposes; numerous small farms produced various grain crops and provided pasture for livestock

date.headline: During World War II
date.text: During World War II, the land that would become the Paducah Site was part of the 16,126-acre tract assembled for construction of the Kentucky Ordnance Works (KOW)

date.headline: Expand Capacity
date.text: The U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) predecessor, the Atomic Energy Commission, began efforts to expand fissionable material production capacity. Eight government-owned sites initially were selected as candidate areas.

date.headline: Paducah Site Approved
date.text: On October 18, 1950, the Paducah Site was approved for uranium enrichment operations and the site was transferred to the Atomic Energy Commission.

date.headline: Plant operations begin
date.text: Plant operations begin using reprocessed material from other nuclear facilities.

date.headline: First Product Shipped
date.text: First enriched uranium product shipped. AEC announced plans to enlarge the plant to double production.

date.headline: 9.7 million megawatt hours
date.text: PGDP used 9.7 million megawatt hours of electricity and spent of $49.5 million for its power supply for that year. Recycled uranium from nuclear reactors becomes feed material into the Plant's enrichment 'cascade' requiring DUF6 conversion process

date.headline: Construction Completed
date.text: Construction of PGDP completed - it took 23,000 employees representing 19 crafts; total project cost $800 million.

date.headline: Work for Others Begins
date.text: Work for Others program begins; over next 30 years it includes work on out of service nuclear weapons, lead doors, counterweights, lunar lander components for NASA, shielding for ORNL, electronics for Sandia, and more

date.headline: Conversion Process
date.text: Conversion Process for DUF6 to Uranium Metal in the C-340 facility was shut down

date.headline: Cascade Feed Material Switched
date.text: Cascade feed material switched to UF6 made from virgin-mined uranium

date.headline: PGDP Shifts
date.text: PGDP shifts from military mission to commercial application to supply enriched uranium to nuclear power plants

date.headline: Metal Ingots
date.text: East and West End Smelters installed (Work for Others program); smelts reusable and contaminated metals into ingots

date.headline: Recycled Uranium
date.text: Use of recycled uranium resumed in 1969 and continued through 1976

date.headline: EPA Established
date.text: EPA was established to consolidate in one agency a variety of federal research, monitoring, standard-setting and enforcement activities to ensure environmental protection

date.headline: Cascade Upgrade
date.text: Major upgrade of plant cascades over next nine years- cost $550 million

date.headline: Test Biodegradation
date.text: Land-farming of waste oils contaminated with uranium, PCBs, and solvents begins to test biodegradation as a treatment option

date.headline: Recycling Uranium Halted
date.text: The practice of recycling uranium feed material from nuclear reactors was halted and never resumed

date.headline: Feed Plant Shutdown
date.text: Feed plant in the C-410/420 complex is shut down

date.headline: Energy Research
date.text: Functions of the Energy Research & Development Administration transferred to the newly created Department of Energy

date.headline: Cylinder Testing
date.text: Freezing process used in drop testing for structural integrity of cylinders

date.headline: CERCLA Law
date.text: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) was enacted by Congress providing guidelines and procedure needed to respond to releases or threatened releases of hazardous substances that could endanger public health or the environment

date.headline: PCB Cleanup Action
date.text: Discovery of high PCB levels in ditch leads to cleanup action with ~ 1,300 drums removed

date.headline: TCE Leak Discovered
date.text: Discovery of RCRA-hazardous waste results in closure/capping of C 404 Burial Ground. Discovery of TCE overflow into sewer - TCE later determined to be primary groundwater contaminant

date.headline: TCE Contamination Discovered
date.text: Contamination found in residential wells; extension of city water lines begins - DOE Water Policy established; CERCLA Administrative Consent order with EPA

date.headline: Environmental Management Program
date.text: DOE established the Environmental Management program to address the contamination and waste created by nuclear weapons production, research, and testing activities during the Manhattan Project and the Cold War era consistent with applicable environmental laws

date.headline: CERCLA Site
date.text: Phase II of CERCLA site investigation to determine on-site source areas begins

date.headline: Signs Posted
date.text: Controls put in place and signs posted to inform individuals of harmful contaminants

date.headline: Energy Policy Act
date.text: Energy Policy Act creates USEC to take over government uranium enrichment enterprise

date.headline: USEC Leasing
date.text: DOE leased the plant production operation facilities to United States Enrichment Corporation (USEC)

date.headline: Treatment Systems
date.text: DOE begins construction of treatment systems to remove TCE from groundwater; more than 2 billion gallons treated in first 15 years of operation

date.headline: EPA National Priorities List
date.text: Paducah added to EPA National Priorities List (Superfund Site)

date.headline: Contaminated Discharge Rerouted
date.text: Contaminated discharge water coming from a maintenance building is rerouted from a drainage ditch to a series of pipes

date.headline: Removing TCE Contamination
date.text: Development begins on a technology to remove TCE contamination from soils without excavation. Called LasagnaTM, the technology is designed for use in Paducah and proves more than 98% effective

date.headline: New Concrete Pads
date.text: Construction begins on new concrete pads to improve storage conditions for cylinders containing depleted uranium hexafluoride

date.headline: U-Landfill Constructed
date.text: U-Landfill is constructed - solid waste landfill covers 59.7 acres and includes a liner and leachate collection system

date.headline: FFA Signed
date.text: Federal Facility Agreement signed, establishing cleanup schedule. USEC becomes privatized.

date.headline: Removal of Drum Mountain
date.text: Removal of Drum Mountain, a 35-foothigh mound of crushed drums from cascade upgrade in 1970s,found to be a major source of PCB contamination

date.headline: USEC Consolidates
date.text: USEC consolidates all enrichment activity to Paducah

date.headline: Contaminated Soils are Excavated
date.text: Contaminated soils are excavated from a drainage ditch running through the center of the plant and replaced with clean dirt

date.headline: Miscellaneous Waste Removed
date.text: Removal of miscellaneous wastes and debris form 160 storage areas begins; 18 of the areas were located outside

date.headline: Unused Facilities Removal
date.text: Began accelerated removal of unused facilities with no potential for future use

date.headline: Site Management Plan
date.text: Site Management Plan approved by regulators

date.headline: Nitrogen Facility Demolition
date.text: Completed D&D of C-603 Nitrogen Facility

date.headline: Lime House Demolition
date.text: Demolition of the Lime House completed

date.headline: Scrap Metal Removal
date.text: Removal of more than 30,500 tons of scrap metal completed

date.headline: Completed DUF6 Facility Construction
date.text: Completed Paducah Depleted Uranium Hexafluoride (DUF6) facility construction to convert the DUF6 into Uranium oxide for disposall

date.headline: C-400 Phase I
date.text: Ammonia Dissociator Facility demolished. Construction begans on treatment system to remove TCE from 100 feet below ground

date.headline: Accelerated D&D Work
date.text: Demolished two 66-year-old concrete water towers in WKWMA. Removed lead-contaminated soil from Firing Range. Shipped for disposal all of mixed LLW 'legacy waste.'

date.headline: TCE Source Removal System
date.text: Began operations of TCE Source Removal System. Completed demolition of East End Smelter and Metal Reduction Plant support facilities. Completed removal of HF Lagoon and contaminated soils/sediments from site ditches.

date.headline: DUF6 Fully Operational
date.text: DUF6 Conversion Facility reached fully operational status

date.headline: Uranium Enrichment Ends
date.text: Uranium enrichment process ends after 61 years of operations.
